revised_title: Cell Lamination and Brain Structure of the Lemur
tldr: The author conducted a comprehensive study of the cell lamination and brain structure of the lemur, using microscopical examination of sections of the cerebral cortex from four different lemur species. They mapped out the various areas and their extents, and observed similarities and differences between the lemur's brain and those of other mammals, such as carnivores, ungulates, and apes. The study provides insights into the unique features of the lemur's brain, including its well-developed olfactory area, and its similarities to the brains of higher primates in some aspects.
